page.title: 02STIBBINGTON AND SUTTON
page.content: The village of{Stibbington}consists of approximately sixty dwellings. The houses are generally located along a single road. The houses vary in size and style. In the centre of the village there is an old, large house called Stibbington Hall. The oldest part of the village lies around the church whilst the newer part is near to the A1 road, where some council houses have been built. The Field Studies Centre is also near the A1. Stibbington village is separated from its neighbour, Sutton by the River Nene. { Sutton}is a tiny village consisting of a church and a collection of mostly old and expensive houses. Like most other villages in this area it has few facilities. The village is very quiet since access to it is by a minor road off the A47.
